title: The Dirt on Laundry
body:
We all have our own way of doing laundry. Our team would like to learn about how you do yours. To help us, snap a few photographs of each phase of your laundry cycle. Capture tools, devices, products, spaces, and machines involved in your process. We want to see everything; the more unique the better.

Here are some things to consider:

  • Your laundry room setup / where you do your laundry
  • Your laundry products and how you store them
  • Important product details/features
  • Tools you use (measuring spoon, drying rack, clothes line, clothes pins, etc.)
  • How you collect, store, and carry your laundry from place to place
  • How you sort your laundry before washing and/or drying
  • Pre-wash treatments
  • Unique washing methods or treatments
  • Machines/devices you interact with during the laundry process
  • How you dry wet laundry
  • How you store and preserve clean laundry

Thanks for Sharing!
teaser:
We all have our own way of doing laundry. Our team would like to learn about how you do yours. To help us, snap a few photographs of each phase of your laundry cycle. Capture tools, devices, products, spaces, and machines involved in your process. We want to see everything; the more unique the better.

Here are some things to consider:
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Feel free to use the frogMOB iPhone app to make the process even simpler!

title: My Connected Life
body:
What’s your best example of connecting your home – or your life – to work super smoothly? Airtunes? A universal remote? A media server for all your DVDs? Your Roku? A great hack?

Snap a photo of the thing – but also shoot for an image of the experience it creates: You and your friends watching a movie? The kid’s Facetime with the cousins? WoW with your mates?
 
Share your awesome home in two images: your set up, and the experiences it enables. And check out what others have posted. Thanks!
teaser:
What’s your best example of connecting your home – or your life – to work super smoothly? Airtunes? A universal remote? A media server for all your DVDs? Your Roku? A great hack?

Snap a photo of the thing – but also shoot for an image of the experience it creates: You and your friends watching a movie? The kid’s Facetime with the cousins? WoW with your mates?
 
Share your awesome home in two images: your set up, and the experiences it enables. And check out what others have posted. Thanks!
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Show off your greatest home media achievements! Show your connected home in 2 images: your set up; and you experiencing it.

title: Staying Hydrated
body:
We are interested in the broad topic of 'drinking to stay hydrated'. How do people around the world quench their thirst when away from home? Do they buy drinks from vending machines or stores?  Or do they drink free water from fountains or taps? When and how do they drink? What about transporting it…are they carrying bottles or other containers around?

Please send us your original pics (not images you find online) and remember to add a brief note or story about your photo.
teaser:
We are interested in the broad topic of 'drinking to stay hydrated'. How do people around the world quench their thirst when away from home? Do they buy drinks from vending machines or stores?  Or do they drink free water from fountains or taps? When and how do they drink? What about transporting it…are they carrying bottles or other containers around?

Please send us your original pics (not images you find online) and remember to add a brief note or story about your photo.
name: admin

field_description_short.value: How does one quench their thirst on the go? Do they buy beverages or drink from fountains? When, how and where do they drink?

title: Beyond Photo Sharing
body:
We document our lives in many ways. We record special events like trips, birthday parties and weddings. And we capture daily occurrences like a good meal and random interlude.

How do you make your memories and experiences shareable?

Think beyond just sharing photos on Facebook or in a text message. We want to see your unique ways of sharing your memories and engaging your audience. How do you capture and share what you personally see, hear, touch, and smell? Do you photograph, video, write, or draw?

Think about both the digital and physical ways you share experiences.

Here are some ideas to get you thinking:

  • Creating a picture book that tells the story of your trip
  • Recording stories your grandfather tells
  • Displaying corks from your favorite bottles of wine
  • Painting a picture of a favorite family vacation spot
  • Making a video and a playlist of songs about your school days
  • Covering a wall of your home with a collage of places you’ve been


Please send us your original pics (not images you find online) and remember to add a brief note or story about your photo.

Thanks! Have fun!
teaser:
We document our lives in many ways. We record special events like trips, birthday parties and weddings. And we capture daily occurrences like a good meal and random interlude.

How do you make your memories and experiences shareable?

Think beyond just sharing photos on Facebook or in a text message. We want to see your unique ways of sharing your memories and engaging your audience. How do you capture and share what you personally see, hear, touch, and smell? Do you photograph, video, write, or draw?
name: admin

field_description_short.value: How do you make your memories and experiences shareable? Think beyond just sharing photos on Facebook or in a text message.

title: Gifting Rituals
body:
People have been giving and getting gifts for millennia. And every culture has ritualized gifting practices embedded within its collective consciousness. What makes a gift a gift? What makes an occasion special or unique? How does giving or getting a gift impact personal relationships? We would like to illustrate a full spectrum of this giving and receiving story, behaviours and artifacts, as seen from wherever you are or wherever you may have been.  

Please share with us examples of where you have either witnessed or participated in a gifting-related event, ceremony or environment. We are interested in a variety of contexts including but not limited to weddings, birthdays, cultural or regional community practices as well as retail seasons and events. Both the material artifact and context of the gifting ritual are of significance to our study.

Please note: if your ideas center around branded content, please be sure to submit your own photos rather than copyrighted material.
teaser: People have been giving and getting gifts for millennia. And every culture has ritualized gifting practices embedded within its collective consciousness. What makes a gift a gift? What makes an occasion special or unique? How does giving or getting a gift impact personal relationships? We would like to illustrate a full spectrum of this giving and receiving story, behaviours and artifacts, as seen from wherever you are or wherever you may have been.
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Please share with us examples of where you have either witnessed or participated in a gifting-related event or ceremony.

title: Mobile Learning
body:
We’re exploring how mobile devices - such as smartphones and tablets – are changing the way children, teens and young adults engage with parents and educators when it comes to acquiring and sharing knowledge.

We’re curious to understand what "mobile learning" can currently mean in its broadest sense, and not just purely within traditional "schooling" paradigms.

What mobile applications or websites have you, your children, or your pupils successfully used to learn new skills or share knowledge with one another? What are the scenarios in which digital mobile tools excel at engaging and motivating younger audiences?

Please show us pictures and tell us stories related to your Mobile Learning experiences. We want original photos that you've personally taken, so please no images from other sites such as Flickr, and no screenshots of applications or websites.
teaser:
We’re exploring how mobile devices - such as smartphones and tablets – are changing the way children, teens and young adults engage with parents and educators when it comes to acquiring and sharing knowledge.

We’re curious to understand what "mobile learning" can currently mean in its broadest sense, and not just purely within traditional "schooling" paradigms.
name: admin

field_description_short.value: How are mobile devices changing the way parents and educators engage with children, teens and young adults.

title: We Like to Move It, Move It
body:
It’s already one month into the brand spanking new 2012. And now that the ball has dropped and the confetti has been swept away, it's the perfect time to reflect if you've dropped the ball on your own resolutions for a new and healthier you.

Share with us some of the ways that you are staying active- from hiking the highest mountain to biking across the city to even just choosing stairs over the elevator.

What moves you towards a healthier you?

title: Customization
body:
From MINI Coopers to sneakers to insurance policies, we increasingly want more control in shaping the products and services we buy.

Share with us some of the favorite things you've customized to your needs, climate, behaviors, family, etc. What drove you to customize it, and what about it meets your unique requirements?

title: Holiday Shopping
body:
We all do it, even if we dread it – that's right, it's holiday shopping. We'd love to learn about your experiences during holiday shopping – both for yourself, and for your friends and family. Have a tool you use to manage lists or prices? Have particular places you go, or things you look for? We want to know!

We want to know how you and/or your family manage your holiday shopping. This frogMob is focused on what you do to plan/prepare for holiday shopping, what you do while you're shopping (online and in-store) and how you manage your purchases. This can be shopping for yourself, or shopping for others – the latter including how you learn about gift desires of friends and family.
teaser: We all do it, even if we dread it – that's right, it's holiday shopping. We'd love to learn about your experiences during holiday shopping – both for yourself, and for your friends and family. Have a tool you use to manage lists or prices? Have particular places you go, or things you look for? We want to know!
name: admin

field_description_short.value: We want to know how you and/or your family manage your holiday shopping.

title: Soundspaces
body:
From canceling out background noise at work to getting motivated for a run, we use audio to shape our experience. Show us and tell us about how you wear, store, and use your personal audio equipment.

On the go, headphones range from fashion status symbol to throwaway stopgaps. Corded? Wireless? How do you wear them? How do you store them? Do your headphones get put on in the morning and don’t come off until the end of the day? Take a picture of yourself wearing your favorite headphones and tell us what song you’re listening to…or show us your headphones and your device(s)!

What’s your audio set-up like at home or on the road? Do you have a special listening chair/speaker arrangement that you’ve finely tuned for relaxation? 

What’s your plan for listening to music throughout the home while you clean or move about? What about in your car? On a plane? Show us and tell us about the places that you consume audio…
teaser:
From canceling out background noise at work to getting motivated for a run, we use audio to shape our experience. Show us and tell us about how you wear, store, and use your personal audio equipment.

On the go, headphones range from fashion status symbol to throwaway stopgaps. Corded? Wireless? How do you wear them? How do you store them? Do your headphones get put on in the morning and don’t come off until the end of the day? Take a picture of yourself wearing your favorite headphones and tell us what song you’re listening to…or show us your headphones and your device(s)!
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Headphones? Speakers? We shape our experience with audio. Show us how you wear, store, and use your audio equipment.

title: Instant Inspiration
body:
From the unexpected on the street corner to the curated beauty of the highly composed, the world around us informs and inspires ourdesign. The camera lens shadows the meaning we make in our minds – but allows us to share what we see. Snap an image and share what inspires you.
 
Share your observations and sample widely! This frogMOB seeks any and all inspirations you'd like to share, from anywhere in the world. And its where we share ours with you.
teaser:
From the unexpected on the street corner to the curated beauty of the highly composed, the world around us informs and inspires ourdesign. The camera lens shadows the meaning we make in our minds – but allows us to share what we see. Snap an image and share what inspires you.
 
Share your observations and sample widely! This frogMOB seeks any and all inspirations you'd like to share, from anywhere in the world. And its where we share ours with you.

title: Food Trucks
body:
Thanks for sharing your tweeting trucks, swanky cupcake startups, and tasty tacos! Food trucks are on the rise with highly individual, non-corporate eating and unique food service experiences.

Trends Observed in this frogMOB:

  • Square is the payment tool of choice.
  • Food trucks are a business of choice for young foodie couples (low investment and only monthly overhead means you can get out when you need to)
  • Limited spaces mean limited menus with focus on differentiation from competitors
  • Sizing up the competition is common and seeking the one differentiator that will get cars to stop is key
  • Food trucks congregate for success – high rent has a bathroom, lights, and some permanent structures. Low rent has a porta-potty and little else but parking.
  • Food truck lots are often positioned near ATMs and liquor stores.
  • Explicit invitation of canine companions invites the locals in.
teaser:
Thanks for sharing your tweeting trucks, swanky cupcake startups, and tasty tacos! Food trucks are on the rise with highly individual, non-corporate eating and unique food service experiences.

Trends Observed in this frogMOB:
name: admin

1805.name: Foodtruck local hidden bar Austin eastsideking

field_description_short.value: Making tasties in tiny spaces, food trucks jury-rig and workaround to make unique food experiences. Thanks for sharing!

title: Techno-Parasites
body: Take pictures of technical installations that are mounted on objects that already existed in a public spaces. Examples include a WLAN station on the outside of a building, a cigarette machine on a fence, or a solar panel on a street light. Focus on the mounting technique and the aesthetic implication of the object.
teaser: Take pictures of technical installations that are mounted on objects that already existed in a public spaces. Examples include a WLAN station on the outside of a building, a cigarette machine on a fence, or a solar panel on a street light. Focus on the mounting technique and the aesthetic implication of the object.

field_description_short.value: Take pictures of technical installations that are mounted on objects that already existed in a public spaces.

title: Social Air Travel
body:
We’re exploring how your friends and social connections influence your travel decisions, especially if you are taking a plane.

We’re curious about what ‘social’ means - in its broadest sense - across the air travel experience: from getting inspired about where to go, to planning & booking, to the time spent on a plane, to arriving in an unknown location, to coming back and sharing memories…

Who do you contact before, during or after flying off to a holiday destination or going on a long-distance business trip etc.?
What are those ‘travel moments’ when you make connections, in-person or digitally, to other people, communities or resources?

Please show us pictures and tell us stories about your 'social' travel experience and situations. We want original photos that you've personally taken, so please no images from other sites such as Flickr.

Here are a few ideas to get started:

  • Do you plan to take a plane anytime soon? Will you ask friends or contacts for advice? How?
  • How do you influence the plans of others or how do you benefit from their travel experiences?
  • What are inspiring moments while traveling that you might like to share with others? When? How?
  • How do you track where you've been?
  • How do you share your travel memories?
teaser:
We’re exploring how your friends and social connections influence your travel decisions, especially if you are taking a plane.

We’re curious about what ‘social’ means - in its broadest sense - across the air travel experience: from getting inspired about where to go, to planning & booking, to the time spent on a plane, to arriving in an unknown location, to coming back and sharing memories…
name: admin

title: Packaging and Instructions
body:
Hi everyone,

We are exploring what people think about packaging and instructions – things that are visually interesting and easy to understand.

Please show us pictures and tell us stories about packages and instructions in your home, or in your favorite stores. We want original photos that you've snapped, so please no images from other sites (like Flickr) and no screen-shots!

Here are a few ideas to get you started:

  • Packages you’ve kept (and stored away in closets or storage spaces)
  • Beautiful/Ugly packages
  • Packaging that stands out in the store (looks intuitive, easy to use, informative, interesting, etc.)
  • Eco-friendly packaging you find interesting
  • Instructions and guides you hold on to (for tools, kitchen equipment, computers, gadgets and electronics, etc.)
  • Helpful instructions (the easiest set up experience you’ve ever had)

Thank you for your help and contributions.

Enjoy your research!
teaser:
Hi everyone,

We are exploring what people think about packaging and instructions – things that are visually interesting and easy to understand.

Please show us pictures and tell us stories about packages and instructions in your home, or in your favorite stores. We want original photos that you've snapped, so please no images from other sites (like Flickr) and no screen-shots!

Here are a few ideas to get you started:
name: sffrogmob

title: Refrigerator
body:
Histories of interaction with the refrigerator and alternative storage solutions

We’re seeking photos that capture your interaction (physical and/or digital) with your refrigerator. We are exploring refrigerators around the world both inside and outside. These photographs serve a dual purpose, both to inform about the various refrigerator solution and uses but equally importantly to inspire us with new ideas for design solutions.

Please show us pictures and tell us stories about your fridge.

You might want to consider:

  • Things you like about your fridge freezer
  • Things you dislike about it
  • Do you have original / alternative refrigeration solution you like?
  • Do you have storage solution you love and would like to see applied in a fridge?

Remember, we want you to send us original photos you've snapped, so please no images from other sites (like Flickr) and no screen-shots!

Thank you for your help and contributions!

Enjoy your research!!
teaser:
Histories of interaction with the refrigerator and alternative storage solutions

We’re seeking photos that capture your interaction (physical and/or digital) with your refrigerator. We are exploring refrigerators around the world both inside and outside. These photographs serve a dual purpose, both to inform about the various refrigerator solution and uses but equally importantly to inspire us with new ideas for design solutions.

Please show us pictures and tell us stories about your fridge.

You might want to consider:
name: admin

title: Good Deals
body:
We are looking to understand how you become aware of deals, sales, and promotions. Are you a casual deal browser? Do you actively seek out deals on specific things? What resources and tools are most valuable to you? Why do you act on a deal or discount?

Please show us examples of where and how you find a good deal. Give us images that express what makes you take interest in a specific deal, sale, or promotion. This is not constrained to any kind of product or service, but if your ideas center around branded content, please be sure to submit your own photos rather than copyrighted material.

Share your insights with us by submitting photos and annotations that show good examples relative to:

- Offline & Printed materials
- Online Resources
- Mobile Applications & Services
- In-Store Signage and Promotion
- Other / Anything else!
teaser: We are looking to understand how you become aware of deals, sales, and promotions. Are you a casual deal browser? Do you actively seek out deals on specific things? What resources and tools are most valuable to you? Why do you act on a deal or discount?
name: sffrogmob

title: My Hawaii
body: We are seeking photos of what the Hawaiian Islands mean to you. The meaning of a place changes depending on your personal experience. Help us understand YOUR perspective about the Hawaiian islands! Tell us your stories and share with us your impressions: Visitors - What you think of when you reflect back? What have you brought back? What memories did you capture? Locals - What does your Hawaii look like? Who are the people of your community? What is important about this place to you? Dreamers - Where do you dream about going? What local culture and experiences do you hope to discover? This frogMob will inform our understanding of Hawaii and will inspire insights and concepts to improve the travel experience to and within the islands.
teaser: We are seeking photos of what the Hawaiian Islands mean to you. The meaning of a place changes depending on your personal experience. Help us understand YOUR perspective about the Hawaiian islands! Tell us your stories and share with us your impressions: Visitors - What you think of when you reflect back? What have you brought back? What memories did you capture? Locals - What does your Hawaii look like? Who are the people of your community? What is important about this place to you?
name: celine.pering

title: Personal Data
body:
Who do you trust?

Throughout our rich digital lives, companies are collecting information about us, practically 24/7, and our data is as good as currency. frogMob wants your thoughts on who you DO and DON'T trust with your personal data. Help us imagine what the future of personal-data-informed experiences COULD be! We want to see your fresh ideas on this inspired by the world around you.

Share your stories and insights with us by submitting photos of:

  • Devices, brands, and environments you DO or DON’T trust with your personal data
  • Objects or environments that you would WANT to collect or access your personal data in exchange for improved user experiences
  • Symbols, marks, and messaging that you come across in the world that COMMUNICATE trust, or the opposite - that make you feel INSECURE about your data
teaser:
Who do you trust?

Throughout our rich digital lives, companies are collecting information about us, practically 24/7, and our data is as good as currency. frogMob wants your thoughts on who you DO and DON'T trust with your personal data. Help us imagine what the future of personal-data-informed experiences COULD be! We want to see your fresh ideas on this inspired by the world around you.

Share your stories and insights with us by submitting photos of:
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Data thieves. Shredders. Password aggregators. 225+ reactions to managing personal data and trust from money to healthcare.

title: Energy Use
body: We are seeking photos that capture the ways in which you reduce your energy consumption or your environmental impact. What aspects of energy consumption frustrate you? We all have different elements of our environment that trigger positive behavior changes. Show us what has inspired you to change your behavior or has raised your awareness around energy use (signage, products, information) and let us see what energy problems you have solved or want to solve (appliances, commuting, renewable energy, home efficiency, composting, recycling, etc.) This frogMob will inform concepts generated at frog's Energy ThinkIn to be held in our San Francisco studio on Oct 27th in partnership with the Smart Grid Consumer Collaborative (SGCC).
teaser: We are seeking photos that capture the ways in which you reduce your energy consumption or your environmental impact. What aspects of energy consumption frustrate you? We all have different elements of our environment that trigger positive behavior changes. Show us what has inspired you to change your behavior or has raised your awareness around energy use (signage, products, information) and let us see what energy problems you have solved or want to solve (appliances, commuting, renewable energy, home efficiency, composting, recycling, etc.)
name: celine.pering

title: Workbenches
body: DIY, garage business, artist-in-residence, jobs, school – we all have spaces where we keep and work on our hardware projects. Share your storage triumphs, your multi-use miracles, and stories of how you work where you work. Snap a photo and submit it to the Workbench frogMob – a place we can gather images of where we work, share and find inspirations. We’ll look for great ideas, patterns and the unexpected from your images and share them back with you. Open Hardware – Open Workbenches.
teaser: DIY, garage business, artist-in-residence, jobs, school – we all have spaces where we keep and work on our hardware projects. Share your storage triumphs, your multi-use miracles, and stories of how you work where you work. Snap a photo and submit it to the Workbench frogMob – a place we can gather images of where we work, share and find inspirations. We’ll look for great ideas, patterns and the unexpected from your images and share them back with you. Open Hardware – Open Workbenches.

field_description_short.value: At the Open Hardware Summit, DIY-ers from around the world shared how they've created spaces for DIY hardware creation.

title: Mobile Computing
body:
We want to understand what people do with (and to) their tablets and smartphones. Have you ditched your TV for your iPad? Has your iPhone become the family video camera and editing suite? Are you considering turning your Android device into a microscope? We’re seeking photos that reveal how you carry, customize and mod your smartphone and/or tablet to fit your needs. Show us!

  • Where you use it. Work? Dinner table? Car? (careful!) Treadmill? Where?
  • How you use it. Watching video? Gaming? Note taking? Night light? Do you use it differently in different places? How?
  • How you carry it. Custom case? Extreme care? Unprotected like a book? How?
  • How it’s customized. Have you purchased accessories or created your own? What breaks, mods or workarounds have you done to it? Custom apps? Is it recognizable as an iPad? Stickers? Soldered appendages?
  • Unintended usage. What are you doing with your iPad that Apple never intended it to be used for?
teaser: We want to understand what people do with (and to) their tablets and smartphones. Have you ditched your TV for your iPad? Has your iPhone become the family video camera and editing suite? Are you considering turning your Android device into a microscope? We’re seeking photos that reveal how you carry, customize and mod your smartphone and/or tablet to fit your needs. Show us!
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Tablet over TV? iPhone over video camera? 75 ways people have customized new devices to fit their needs.

title: Dashboards
body: Car dashboards are constantly evolving, with more information and controls packed into the limited space surrounding the driver, competing for their limited attention. We are looking for visuals and stories that describe how modern dashboards are succeeding at enhancing the driving experience, and how they are failing. Show us how people are modifying or customizing their dashboards. What are they adding or removing and why? What items do people keep on or around their dashboards and why? What is in the glovebox and all those little compartments? Show us anything unusual or unexpected, whether it is part of the dashboard design or something the driver added. The focus of our research is on luxury, middle class and compact cars, but we are open to other vehicle dashboards if the story is compelling.
teaser: Car dashboards are constantly evolving, with more information and controls packed into the limited space surrounding the driver, competing for their limited attention. We are looking for visuals and stories that describe how modern dashboards are succeeding at enhancing the driving experience, and how they are failing. Show us how people are modifying or customizing their dashboards. What are they adding or removing and why? What items do people keep on or around their dashboards and why? What is in the glovebox and all those little compartments?
name: admin

field_description_short.value: Drivers from Afghanistan to Valencia CA shared stories and examples of the best and worst of their cars' dashboard consoles.

title: Power
body: We all need power to live with technological infrastructures - whether at-home, at-work, or in-transit. Although power is everywhere, there aren't many good solutions out there. We cobble together impromptu solutions and make the best of what we have. We want to know what problems or solutions have you found?
teaser: We all need power to live with technological infrastructures - whether at-home, at-work, or in-transit. Although power is everywhere, there aren't many good solutions out there. We cobble together impromptu solutions and make the best of what we have. We want to know what problems or solutions have you found?
name: celine.pering

field_description_short.value: We need power, but cords are a mess. Mobsters shared 300+ impromptu solutions and 'dirty fixes' for cord management.

title: World Cup
body:
<!--break-->
We leveraged the World Cup 2010 event to explore how devices have allowed for new forms of multi-tasking, ways of handling place-shifting and time-shifting, and methods that people employ to track a live event in a social context while constrained by time zone differences.
teaser: The state of TV viewing is evolving rapidly. Our client wanted to uncover compelling use cases related to the changes in how people are now watching TV.
name: admin

field_description_short.value: For World Cup 2010 we found devices encouraging new ways of multitasking, place- and time-shifting for a global community.

title: Work bikes
body:
<!--break-->
Special attention was given to customizations and “dirty fixes” that expose hidden needs. More than 200 photos with detailed insights from cities around the globe were submitted after just one week. Results were synthesized and grouped according to function of a bike.
teaser: Our goal was to discover insights about bike design by closely examining work bikes—defined as any bike that someone uses to make a living.
name: admin

field_description_short.value: When designing products 'dirty fixes' and customizations expose hidden needs. Over 200 photos came in globally on bikes.
